page.title: 04Peats.
page.content: In Bernera we cut peat for fuel.Wehave to set a day in spring to cut the peats with a team of six or eight people then pay them all back whenever they set a day aside for it. The peats are cut with a 'tairsgear' or peat_iron; one person cutting the peats and another thowing them on to the dry ground to dry out. Within a fortnight (according to the weather) the peats are ready to stand up in small heaps until they are dry enough to be taken home by tractor from the peat bank. The tractor gets to the peat bank and in a few loads takes all the peats home where they are made into a "cruach" or stack which will last a year.
